intro: Calochortus exilis, commonly known as the slender globemallow, is a species of flowering plant in the family Portulacaceae. It is native to the western United States, particularly California, where it thrives in rocky soils and open habitats. The plant is characterized by its small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink, often with a yellow center. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Calochortus exilis is often found in coastal and inland areas, preferring full sun and well-drained soil.
